summary: Paramjit S. Ajrawat, M.D. was found guilty of multiple federal crimes including health care fraud, wire fraud, false statements, obstruction of justice, and aggravated identity theft, stemming from a scheme to defraud health care programs. As a result of these convictions, which constitute crimes of moral turpitude, his Maryland medical license (D32506) is suspended. He was also sentenced to 111 months imprisonment and ordered to pay over $3.1 million in restitution.
